newsitem.title: USA: Farmland sees potential to up US pork exports.
newsitem.headline: Farmland sees potential to up US pork exports.

text.p: The United States has the opportunity to raise the number of hogs produced by about 40 percent between now and 2005 and supply 50 percent of international pork demands, Harry Cleberg, chief executive officer of Farmland Industries Inc said Tuesday.

"It's doable. We have the efficiency. We have the technology. We have the land mass and we have the brains to accomplish that," Cleberg said in a speech at the U.S. Agriculture Department's annual Agricultural Outlook Forum.
